Package apryraz.tworld

Class TreasureFinder

java.lang.Object
apryraz.tworld.TreasureFinder
public class TreasureFinder extends Object
This agent performs a sequence of movements, and after each movement it "senses" from the evironment the resulting position and then the outcome from the smell sensor, to try to locate the position of Treasure

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    TreasureFinder(int WDim, TreasureWorldEnv enviroment)
    The class constructor must create the initial Boolean formula with the rules of the Treasure World, initialize the variables for indicating that we do not have yet any movements to perform, make the initial state.

    addImplicationClauses()
    Adds all implications for each sensor and positions on the map For each sensor: For each xy in N*N: Sxy -> -"all except(+ or corners)" or -"9x9 around agent" Where: Sensor 1 or Sensor 2 or 3 and xy is the position

  • Constructor Details

    • TreasureFinder

      public TreasureFinder(int WDim, TreasureWorldEnv enviroment)
      The class constructor must create the initial Boolean formula with the rules of the Treasure World, initialize the variables for indicating that we do not have yet any movements to perform, make the initial state.
      Parameters:
      WDim - the dimension of the Treasure World
      enviroment - Enviroment of the problem

  • Method Details

    • setEnvironment

      public void setEnvironment(TreasureWorldEnv environment)
      Store a reference to the Environment Object that will be used by the agent to interact with the Treasure World, by sending messages and getting answers to them. This function must be called before trying to perform any steps with the agent.
      Parameters:
      environment - the Environment object

    • loadListOfSteps

      public void loadListOfSteps(int numSteps, String stepsFile)
      Load a sequence of steps to be performed by the agent. This sequence will be stored in the listOfSteps ArrayList of the agent. Steps are represented as objects of the class Position.
      Parameters:
      numSteps - number of steps to read from the file
      stepsFile - the name of the text file with the line that contains the sequence of steps: x1,y1 x2,y2 ... xn,yn

    • getState

      public TFState getState()
      Returns the current state of the agent.
      Returns:
      the current state of the agent, as an object of class TFState

    • runNextStep

      public void runNextStep() throws IOException, org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException, org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Execute the next step in the sequence of steps of the agent, and then use the agent sensor to get information from the environment. In the original Treasure World, this would be to use the Smelll Sensor to get a binary answer, and then to update the current state according to the result of the logical inferences performed by the agent with its formula.
      Throws:
      IOException
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

    • moveToNext

      public AMessage moveToNext()
      Ask the agent to move to the next position, by sending an appropriate message to the environment object. The answer returned by the environment will be returned to the caller of the function.
      Returns:
      the answer message from the environment, that will tell whether the movement was successful or not.

    • moveTo

      public AMessage moveTo(int x, int y)
      Use agent "actuators" to move to (x,y) We simulate this why telling to the World Agent (environment) that we want to move, but we need the answer from it to be sure that the movement was made with success
      Parameters:
      x - horizontal coordinate of the movement to perform
      y - vertical coordinate of the movement to perform
      Returns:
      returns the answer obtained from the environment object to the moveto message sent

    • processMoveAnswer

      public void processMoveAnswer(AMessage moveans)
      Process the answer obtained from the environment when we asked to perform a movement
      Parameters:
      moveans - the answer given by the environment to the last move message

    • DetectsAt

      public AMessage DetectsAt()
      Send to the environment object the question: "Does the detector sense something around(agentX,agentY) ?"
      Returns:
      return the answer given by the environment

    • processDetectorSensorAnswer

      public void processDetectorSensorAnswer(AMessage ans) throws IOException, org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException, org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      Process the answer obtained for the query "Detects at (x,y)?" by adding the appropriate evidence clause to the formula
      Parameters:
      ans - message obtained to the query "Detects at (x,y)?". It will a message with four fields: detected x y [1,2,3]
      Throws:
      IOException
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

    • addLastFutureClausesToPastClauses

      public void addLastFutureClausesToPastClauses() throws IOException, org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException, org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      This function should add all the clauses stored in the list futureToPast to the formula stored in solver. Use the function addClause( VecInt ) to add each clause to the solver
      Throws:
      IOException
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

    • performInferenceQuestions

      public void performInferenceQuestions() throws IOException, org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException, org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
      This function should check, using the future variables related to possible positions of Treasure, whether it is a logical consequence that Treasure is NOT at certain positions. This should be checked for all the positions of the Treasure World. The logical consequences obtained, should be then stored in the futureToPast list but using the variables corresponding to the "past" variables of the same positions An efficient version of this function should try to not add to the futureToPast conclusions that were already added in previous steps, although this will not produce any bad functioning in the reasoning process with the formula.
      Throws:
      IOException
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

    • buildGamma

      public org.sat4j.specs.ISolver buildGamma() throws UnsupportedEncodingException, FileNotFoundException, IOException, org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      This function builds the initial logical formula of the agent and stores it into the solver object.
      Returns:
      returns the solver object where the formula has been stored
      Throws:
      UnsupportedEncodingException
      FileNotFoundException
      IOException
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

    • addImplicationClauses

      private void addImplicationClauses() throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Adds all implications for each sensor and positions on the map For each sensor: For each xy in N*N: Sxy -> -"all except(+ or corners)" or -"9x9 around agent" Where: Sensor 1 or Sensor 2 or 3 and xy is the position
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

    • addImplicationOutsideSquare

      private void addImplicationOutsideSquare(int x, int y, int detector) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Negates all positions which are not around our X,Y position.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordenate
      y - Y coordenate
      detector - Index of the detector
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

    • addImplicationFromOffsets

      private void addImplicationFromOffsets(int originalX, int originalY, int[][] offsets, int detector) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Given an offset array, used for mapping specific positions around an (x,y) position, creates an implication where those positions are negated.
      Parameters:
      originalX - X position of the cell where offsets are applied.
      originalY - Y position of the cell where offsets are applied.
      offsets - array that contains cell positions around original X,Y
      detector - Index of the detector which causes the implications. (causes the offsets to be negated)
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

    • addDetectorClauses

      private void addDetectorClauses(int dimensions, int detectorCount) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Generates and adds to the solver all the detector clauses for each detector
      Parameters:
      detectorCount - the number of detectors in the agent
      dimensions - the cells in the world NxN
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

    • addWorldClauses

      private void addWorldClauses(int dimensions) throws org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException
      Adds all the world clauses where the treasure can be In past and future
      Parameters:
      dimensions - The number of cells of the world N*N
      Throws:
      org.sat4j.specs.ContradictionException

    • coordToLineal

      public int coordToLineal(int x, int y, int offset)
      Convert a coordinate pair (x,y) to the integer value t_[x,y] of variable that stores that information in the formula, using offset as the initial index for that subset of position variables (past and future position variables have different variables, so different offset values)
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of the position variable to encode
      y - y coordinate of the position variable to encode
      offset - initial value for the subset of position variables (past or future subset)
      Returns:
      the integer indentifer of the variable b_[x,y] in the formula

    • linealToCoord

      public int[] linealToCoord(int lineal, int offset)
      Perform the inverse computation to the previous function. That is, from the identifier t_[x,y] to the coordinates (x,y) that it represents
      Parameters:
      lineal - identifier of the variable
      offset - offset associated with the subset of variables that lineal belongs to
      Returns:
      array with x and y coordinates
